question.title: AWS conflict between aws.java.sdk.core and aws.java.sdk.s3 JDK 21
question.body:
Trying to move an application from JDK 8 to JDK 21 and getting an issue with AWS.

I'm using Eclipse and its pushing me to add both these to the module-info.java

In my pom.xml I'm pulling in the following:

    <dependency>
        <groupId>com.amazonaws</groupId>
        <artifactId>aws-java-sdk-s3</artifactId>
        <version>1.12.642</version>
    </dependency>

In my code I import

import com.amazonaws.AmazonServiceException;
import com.amazonaws.SdkClientException;
import com.amazonaws.regions.Regions;
import com.amazonaws.services.s3.AmazonS3;
with a local variable 
private AmazonS3 s3;

But if I do this I'm getting this error:

java.lang.module.ResolutionException: Modules aws.java.sdk.s3 and aws.java.sdk.core export package com.amazonaws.auth to module org.apache.commons.collections4

I've tried to research this and seem to be leaning that it needs to move to a newer version of the AWS such as this:

<dependency>
    <groupId>software.amazon.awssdk</groupId>
    <artifactId>s3</artifactId>
    <version>2.20.0</version> <!-- Use the latest SDK version -->
</dependency>

Is that the right approach or is there a way to fix it without going this route? Seems like if I go this way then the old code has to basically be rewritten since the library has changed quite a bit.

Am I correct or just heading off in the wrong direction?

answers.body:
This is AWS SDK for Java V1

<dependency>         
  <groupId>com.amazonaws</groupId>     
 <artifactId>aws-java-sdk-s3</artifactId>
 <version>1.12.642</version> 
</dependency>

This is on road to deprecation as discussed here:

https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/developer/announcing-end-of-support-for-aws-sdk-for-java-v1-x-on-december-31-2025/

The best practice is to use AWS SDK for Java V2. You can find Amazon S3 examples that use V2 and JDK 21 in AWS Example github here:

https://github.com/awsdocs/aws-doc-sdk-examples/tree/main/javav2/example_code/s3

question_comments.body: Yes, upgrading is the right choice.
